roadway_dispersion
Class coordinate

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--roadway_dispersion.coordinate
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class coordinate
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

Overview
The coordinate class stores and accesses cartesian coordinates (x,y,z) and provides member functions such as dot, horizontal_angle, and norm to perform simple operations on the coordinates. Note - All units in this file and the model are metric (MKS) unless otherwise stated.

ACTION AND REVISION LOG

 Author         Date        Action
 --------------------------------------------------------------------------
 Tony Held(TH)  11-15-99  cpp file created
 TH             11-20-99  cpp class tested, debuged, and documented
 TH             12-04-99  operator overloading added, vector and angle functions added
 TH             08-16-00  coordinate class ported to java
 TH             10-23-00  class debugged & verified - no additions needed to class

Version:
1.0 (October 2001)

Tony Held

norm

public double norm()
norm returns the 3-D norm (length) of a vector (assumes tail is at the origin).
Returns:
a double value representing the length of a 3-D vector.

horizontal_norm

public double horizontal_norm()
horizontal_norm returns the 2-D norm (length) of a vector (assumes tail is at the origin). Only the x,y coordinates are considered; z is ignored.
Returns:
a double value representing the length of a 2-D vector.

dot

public double dot(coordinate coord1)
dot returns the dot product of the calling vector and the vector passed in the argument.
Parameters:
coord1 - a coordinate value to be dotted with the calling coordinate object.
Returns:
a double value representing the 3-D dot product of the vectors.

horizontal_angle

public double horizontal_angle()
horizontal_angle returns the horizontal angle in radians of the (x,y) coordinates. Result ranges from 0 to 2 pi and uses standard geometric orientations (positive x axis is 0 or 2pi and angles measured counter-clockwise)
Returns:
a double value representing the angle between the (x,y) coordinates an the x-axis in radians.

horizontal_rotation

public void horizontal_rotation(double radian_angle)
This routine will rotate the coordinate in the horizontal plane by a given angle in radians. Standard geometric notations is used (i.e. x-axis is 0 or 2 pi and angles are measured counter-clockwise) the z component will not be affected - only then x & y will be modified
Parameters:
radian_angle - angle to rotate (in the counter clockwise direction) the horizontal vector by.

add

public void add(coordinate coord2)
Member add allows you to sum the coordinates of a coordinate object with another. The coordinate values of the passed parameter will be added to the calling coordinate object.
Parameters:
coord2 - a coordinate value to be added to the calling class

subtract

public void subtract(coordinate coord2)
Member add allows you to subtract the coordinates of a coordinate object from another. The coordinate values of the passed parameter will be subtracted from the calling coordinate object.
Parameters:
coord2 - a coordinate value to be subtracted from the calling class.

multiply

public void multiply(double multiplier)
Member multiply scales a coordinate object by multiplying all of its varibles by a scaling factor.
Parameters:
multiplier - a double value to multiply all of the coordinate varibles by.
